Mastriano's gubernatorial opponent and state Senate Leader Jake Corman this week asked Franklin County District Attorney Matt Fogal to open a probe into whether Mastriano violated campaign finance law and committed perjury in connection with an amended finance report that showed he spent and raised hundreds of thousands of dollars more than previously reported.

Soon after The Philadelphia Inquirer reported that the campaign had not revealed basic expenses found on most finance reports, Mastriano filed an updated report showing he had $1 million in his campaign account at the end of 2021 and had spent about $215,000 that year, about 15 times more than what was originally shown.
